context: The IPCC Panel is composed of <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>representatives appointed by governments and organizations<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. Participation of delegates with appropriate expertise is encouraged. Plenary sessions of the IPCC and <b4_0>IPCC Working groups<b4_0/> are held at the level of government representatives. Non Governmental and Intergovernmental Organizations may be allowed to attend as observers. <b5_0>Sessions of the IPCC Bureau<b5_0/>, workshops, expert and lead authors meetings are by invitation only. Attendance at the <b6_0>2003<b6_0/> meeting included <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>350<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>government officials and climate change experts<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. After the opening ceremonies, <b8_0>closed <b7_0>plenary sessions<b8_0/><b7_0/> were held. The meeting report states there were 322 persons in attendance at Sessions with <a3_0><a3_2>about <a3_1>seven-eighths<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> of participants being from governmental organizations.
